abstract: Record low oil prices hurt results at Exxon and Chevron; Exxon Mobil reports first-quarter profit of $1.8 billion, down from $4.9 billion in year-ago quarter; revenue fell 28 percent; Chevron reports first-quarter loss of $725 million, compared with profit of $2.6 billion in year-ago quarter; revenue fell 30 percent to $23.6 billion.

headline.print_headline: Oil Prices Pinch Results at Chevron and Exxon
headline.main: Low Oil Prices Pinch Exxon and Chevron Earnings

snippet: Exxon Mobil on Friday posted its smallest profit for any quarter since 1999, while Chevron reported a large first-quarter loss of $725 million.
lead_paragraph: Exxon Mobil on Friday posted its smallest profit for any quarter since 1999, while Chevron reported a large first-quarter loss of $725 million.
